ENG3612 - Trends in Literary, Cultural,.name: ENG3612 - Trends in Literary, Cultural, and Textual Studies

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in ENC 1102.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Literary analysis of textual production within contemporary social trends and new technologies.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The theoretical and cultural developments over time that call for broadening the applications of literary analysis to produce "cultural studies."

ENG3836 - Professional Lives and Literac.name: ENG3836 - Professional Lives and Literacy Practices

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of technologyassisted professional writing and literacy practices around knowledge management work in organizations and communities.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Exploration of writing markets and publishing opportunities therein, the submission process, and author marketing and negotiation strategies.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Student evaluation of selected fiction, poetry, and drama through practical exercises in literary criticism.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Job-related skills in scholarly editing; submission, review, and production practices; and ethical and technological issues in editing.

ENG3821 - What's Next For English Majors.name: ENG3821 - What's Next For English Majors

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 and English major or minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Professional development strategies and career options for English majors after graduation.

ENG4614 - Discourse of Global Cultural S.name: ENG4614 - Discourse of Global Cultural Studies

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better required in ENG 3014, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: American popular culture texts in world context, using concepts and theories from global cultural studies to analyze transmission, translation, and appropriation.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENG 3014.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The differences in emphasis, medium, and technique in selected novels and their film adaptations.

ENG3014 - Theories and Techniques of Lit.name: ENG3014 - Theories and Techniques of Literature Study

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Techniques of analysis, theories of interpretation, and application of critical approaches to selected works.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines "debates" in the digital humanities and prepares students to work with the creation, management, and preservation of digital archives content.
